title: Schedule
content:
Schedule# Note:The schedule below is tentative and subject to change.
ðŸ§­ Module 1: Fundamentals# Class 1 â€” Tue, Jan 20, 2026
Introduction
Goal: Introduce the course goals, expectations, and format.
Slides: LINK TO SLIDES (coming soon) Class 2 â€” Thu, Jan 22, 2026
Fundamentals Primer & The Paper "Draft"
Goal: Quick review of common terms and formulations in robotics literature and in-class sign up for paper presentations.
Slides: LINK TO SLIDES (coming soon) Additional Resources: Springer Handbook of Robotics (Chapters TBD) Class 3 â€” Tue, Jan 27, 2026
Fundamentals 1: The Needs and Opportunities of Robots
Goal: We will start with a broad perspective about opportunities for robots and research progress over a longer horizon.
Collaborative Robots and Industrial Revolution 4.0 (IR 4.0) The Evolution of Robotics Research â€” From Industrial Robotics to Field and Service Robotics Class 4 â€” Thu, Jan 29, 2026
Fundamentals 2: Moving Your Robot & Robot Systems
Goal: Robot research often involves deploying full-stack systems and inverse kinematics techniques.
DexPilot: Vision-Based Teleoperation of Dexterous Robotic Handâ€“Arm Systems RelaxedIK: Real-time Synthesis of Accurate and Feasible Robot Arm Motion Class 5 â€” Tue, Feb 3, 2026
Fundamentals 3: Planning Motions
Goal: Review of common planning techniques and modern optimization-based approaches.
Motion Planning: The Essentials Motion Planning Around Obstacles with Convex Optimization Additional Resources: Collision-Affording Point Trees (recent high-performance path planning RSS paper) ðŸ¤– Module 2: Learning# Class 6 â€” Thu, Feb 5, 2026
Learning Primer
Goal: Review high-level robot learning architectures and approaches.
Slides: LINK TO SLIDES (coming soon) Class 7 â€” Tue, Feb 10, 2026
Learning 1:Foundations
Goal: Review classical learning techniques including movement primitives and behavior cloning.
Movement Primitives Behavioral Cloning from Observation Additional Resources: ALVINN: An Autonomous Land Vehicle in a Neural Network (original BC paper) Generative Adversarial Imitation Learning (another historically popular learning technique) Class 8 â€” Thu, Feb 12, 2026
Learning 2:End-to-End & Meta-Learning
Goal: End-to-end learning and early meta-learning approaches for generalization.
End-to-End Learning Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning Class 9 â€” Tue, Feb 17, 2026
Learning 3:Intermediate Representations
Goal: Learning with inferred reward functions and hierarchical correction.
Maximum Entropy Inverse Reinforcement Learning Yell At Your Robot Class 10 â€” Thu, Feb 19, 2026
Literature Review Workshop
Goal: Strategies for finding and evaluating robotics research.
Slides: LINK TO SLIDES (coming soon) Class 11 â€” Tue, Feb 24, 2026
Learning 4:The Rise of Generative Learning
Goal: Inflection point papers in generative robotics.
Do As I Can, Not As I Say: Grounding Language in Robotic Affordances Diffusion Policy: Visuomotor Policy Learning via Action Diffusion Class 12 â€” Thu, Feb 26, 2026
Learning 5:Practical Considerations
Goal: Small design choices that impact learning systems.
What Matters in Learning from Offline Data Continuity of Rotation Representations Additional Resources: Much Ado About Noising: Dispelling the Myths of Generative Robotic Control (recent work questioning the need for architectural components in robotics generative models) Class 13 â€” Tue, Mar 3, 2026
Learning 6: Frontiers
Goal: Recent VLAs including from industry and leveraging video models.
Ï€âˆ— 0.6: a VLA That Learns From Experience mimic-video: Video-Action Models for Generalizable Robot Control Beyond VLAs ðŸ§  Module 3: Interactive Systems# Class 14 â€” Thu, Mar 5, 2026
Interactive Systems Primer
Goal: Introduce challenges and approaches for robot systems that work with people.
Slides: LINK TO SLIDES (coming soon) Additional Resources: A Primer for Conducting Experiments in Humanâ€“Robot Interaction (advice for structuring HRI experiments) Class 15 â€” Tue, Mar 10, 2026
Interactive Systems 1: Teleoperation & Simplifying Human Input
Goal: Investigate lower level of autonomy systems for people to drive robot behavior.
Open-TeleVision: Teleoperation with Immersive Active Visual Feedback Learning Latent Actions to Control Assistive Robots Class 16 â€” Thu, Mar 12, 2026
Implement Something: Mini Presentations
Goal: Lightning presentations of your mini implementation projects
Presentation slides: LINK COMING SOON. Class 17 â€” Tue, Mar 17, 2026
ASYNCHRONOUS: Large Behavior Models
Goal: TRI has been one company leading the push on developing and evaluating foundation models for robotics. We will watch and dicuss a seminar related to their work.
Watch this lecture by Russ Tedrake and comment on the piazza post Additional Resources: A Careful Examination of Large Behavior Models for Multitask Dexterous Manipulation (complementary paper later released by Toyota Research Institute) Class 18 â€” Thu, Mar 19, 2026
ASYNCHRONOUS: The Trajectory of Robotics Research and Human-Centered Robots
Goal: Watch this lecture by Rodney Brooks and comment on the piazza post Class 19 â€” Tue, Mar 24, 2026
Interactive Systems 2: Humanâ€“Robot Collaboration
Goal: Introduces methods for settings of human-robot collaboration.
An Ergo-Interactive Framework for Human-Robot Collaboration Via Learning From Demonstration Goal Inference Improves Objective and Perceived Performance in Human-Robot Collaboration Class 20 â€” Thu, Mar 26, 2026
Interactive Systems 3: Shared Autonomy
Goal: Introduces a classical and recent generative method for shared autonomy.
A policy-blending formalism for shared control To the Noise and Back: Diffusion for Shared Autonomy Spring Break:Tue, Mar 31 & Thu, Apr 2 (No class)
ðŸ§ª Module 4: Simulation & Safety# Class 21 â€” Tue, Apr 7, 2026
Interactive Systems 4: Minimizing User Input
Goal: (to be filled)
Asking Easy Questions: A User-Friendly Approach to Active Reward Learning REALM: Real-Time Estimates of Assistance for Learned Models in Human-Robot Interaction Additional Resources: INQUIRE: INteractive Querying for User-aware Informative REasoning (choosing human inputs based on informativeness in interactive learning) Class 22 â€” Thu, Apr 9, 2026
Simulation & Sim-to-Real
Goal: (to be filled)
Isaac Lab: A GPU-Accelerated Simulation Framework for Multi-Modal Robot Learning Reconciling Reality through Simulation: A Real-to-Sim-to-Real Approach for Robust Manipulation Class 23 â€” Tue, Apr 14, 2026
Safety in Robotics
Goal: (to be filled)
Enhancing Safety in Learning from Demonstration Algorithms via Control Barrier Function Shielding Generalizing Safety Beyond Collision-Avoidance via Latent-Space Reachability Analysis ðŸš€ Module 5: Applications & Projects# Class 24 â€” Thu, Apr 16, 2026
Applications 1: Mobile and Marine Robotics
Goal: (to be filled)
Khronos: A Unified Approach for Spatio-Temporal Metric-Semantic SLAM in Dynamic Environments Ocean One: A Robotic Avatar for Oceanic Discovery Class 25 â€” Tue, Apr 21, 2026
Applications 2: Humanoids and Quadrapeds
Goal: (to be filled)
A Walk in the Park: Learning to Walk in 20 Minutes With Model-Free Reinforcement Learning Ocean One: A Robotic Avatar for Oceanic Discovery Class 26 â€” Thu, Apr 23, 2026
Applications 3: Assistive Robots and UAVs
Goal: (to be filled)
FEAST: A Flexible Mealtime-Assistance System Towards In-the-Wild Personalization Champion-level drone racing using deep reinforcement learning Class 27 â€” Tue, Apr 28, 2026
Project Presentations 1

title: Assignments
content:
Assignment Details (and links)# Paper Presentations
Paper sign-up sheet: LINK Google Slides Template: LINK Instructions and Rubric: LINK Piazza post with slides and discussion topic due 5pm the day before the presentation. Piazza reply with discussion summary due 5pm the day after the presentation. 'Implement Something' Assignment / Presentation
Slides due 3/11 by 5pm. Details coming soon. Final Project
Project Proposal due 3/26 by 5pm. Slides due 4/27 by 5pm. Final Report/Website due 5/6 by 5pm. Detailed instructions and rubrics coming soon.
